intro: Peutalis ligularis, commonly known as the slender leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with white ray florets. It is often found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Peutalis ligularis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
